sentence.Network_en: George was in a quandary —should he go or shouldn't he?
sentence.Network_cn: 乔治犹豫不定—他是该去呢，还是不该去？

sentence.Network_en: I was in a quandary about whether to go.
sentence.Network_cn: 我当时正犹豫到底去不去.

sentence.Network_en: I was put in a great quandary.
sentence.Network_cn: 我陷于进退两难的窘境.

list.abs: 定价上的左右为难pricing quandary定金down payment定金担保利益purchase money security interest定期的规定的租金regular periodic payment定义definition定义上的暧昧不明.

behind all these quandaries , of course , lies the summer's basic political mystery . by this time next year , who will have responsibility for resolving them ?此番窘境，其背后当然是这个夏天的政治迷雾。明年的这个时候，谁能来解开这个谜团呢？

Mr Obama will attend the early stages of the two-week conference – on December 9 – more than a week before other world leaders arrive on December 17 , creating a diplomatic quandary .奥巴马将于12月9日，即为期两周的哥本哈根会议的早期阶段出席会议，比其他全球领导人预期抵达的12月17日早了一个多星期，这造成了一种外交困境。
although unconventional , Mottola and Mazur's Gravastar explanation for Black holes does solve at least one serious quandary created by black hole theory .虽然现在还不清楚需要有多少棕色脂肪，才能对体重产生影响，他认为这不会需要太多。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: perhaps partly from Latin quando 'when'

entry.tran: 困境；窘境;左右为难的境地
entry.def: If you are in a quandary, you have to make a decision but cannot decide what to do.

example.ex: The government appears to be in a quandary about what to do with so many people.
example.tran: 政府似乎陷入了左右为难的境地，不知道该拿这么多人怎么办。

means.word_mean: 1. a situation from which extrication is difficult especially an unpleasant or trying one;

sentences.sentence: "finds himself in a most awkward predicament"

means.word_mean: 2. state of uncertainty or perplexity especially as requiring a choice between equally unfavorable options

sentences.cn: 她拿不准应该选择哪一个工作。
